body_html:
@gautamkmr first of all, please be aware that MKL and MKL-DNN are two separate packages.
MKL contains general BLAS operation such as GEMM (matrix multiplication).
MKL-DNN contains Deep Neural Network operations such as convolution, etc.

Current conda package contains MKL but not MKL-DNN.
You need to compile from source to get MKL-DNN, install MKLDNN and follow normal installation process will be enough.
Also we wrote bkm for cpu performance.
body_text:
@gautamkmr first of all, please be aware that MKL and MKL-DNN are two separate packages.
MKL contains general BLAS operation such as GEMM (matrix multiplication).
MKL-DNN contains Deep Neural Network operations such as convolution, etc.
Current conda package contains MKL but not MKL-DNN.
You need to compile from source to get MKL-DNN, install MKLDNN and follow normal installation process will be enough.
Also we wrote bkm for cpu performance.
body:
@gautamkmr first of all, please be aware that MKL and MKL-DNN are two separate packages.
MKL contains general BLAS operation such as GEMM (matrix multiplication).
MKL-DNN contains Deep Neural Network operations such as convolution, etc.

Current conda package contains **MKL** but not **MKL-DNN**.
You need to compile from source to get MKL-DNN, install [MKLDNN](https://anaconda.org/mingfeima/mkldnn) and follow normal installation process will be enough.
Also we wrote [bkm](https://github.com/intel/pytorch#bkm-on-xeon) for cpu performance.
